Available internships

The CNBC Internship Program is seeking dedicated, hardworking college students to participate in our paid award winning program! As a CNBC intern, there's a wide variety of opportunities that will hone your abilities in whatever field you are interested in.

    A list of all the available internships at CNBC.

Hiring Managers

‹

  • Digital Video

    The digital video intern will learn what it takes to be a digital video producer.

  • Social Media Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Elisa Bellcishta - Social Media

  • Power Lunch Production Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Sandy Cannold - 'Power Lunch'

  • Technology Development Operations Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Dejay Clayton – Technology Development Operations

  • Talent Development Internship

    Talent Development interns will have the opportunity for a hands-on learning experience in the editorial process.

  • Technical Operations Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Jenn Falcone - Technical Operations

  • Program Planning Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Alexandra Gennaro - Program Planning

  • Mad Money Production Internship

    Interns on the "Mad Money with Jim Cramer" team become intimately involved with our production on their first day at CNBC.

  • CNBC Make It Internship

    Interns will work on stories on a variety of topics, including careers, personal finance, and entrepreneurship.

  • Long Form Programming Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Christie Gripenburg - Long Form Programming

  • Primetime Marketing Internship

    The CNBC primetime marketing internship offers you hands-on experience as a member of the marketing team.

  • Software Development Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Ashish Gupta - Software Development

  • Program Research Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Janine Harm - Program Research

  • User Experience Internship

    User Experience (UX) Research intern

  • Quality Engineering Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Prabhu Panchaksharam - Quality Engineering

  • CNBC.com Breaking News Internship

    CNBC.com is offering an immersive writing and editing internship on the digital breaking-news desk.

  • Strategic Content Internship

    The Strategic Content department is CNBC's only cross-platform team, creating editorial content for on-air and cnbc.com.

  • CNBC Assignment Desk Internship

    CNBC's Assignment Desk is seeking interns who will learn what it takes to work in a breaking-news environment.

  • Closing Bell Production Internship

    "Closing Bell" is looking for an intern to be a part of the team that broadcasts the final and most important trading hour — LIVE.

  • Marketing, On Air Promotion Internship

    CNBC Internship Hiring Manager: Lisa Wernick - On-Air Promotion and Scheduling

More CNBC Internship Program

About

The CNBC Internship Program is seeking dedicated, hardworking college students to participate in our paid award winning program! As a CNBC intern, there's a wide variety of opportunities that will hone your abilities in whatever field you are interested in.

About the CNBC Internship Program

CNBC is the recognized world leader in business news, with branches in the United States, Asia-Pacific, Europe, the Middle East and Africa. The network's 14 live daily hours of business programming in North America (weekdays from 5 a.m. - 7 p.m. ET) are produced at CNBC's global headquarters in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, and include reports from CNBC News bureaus worldwide.

There's a wide variety of paid internship opportunities at CNBC that will hone your abilities in whatever field you are interested. Internships are open at the Assignment Desk, “Mad Money” with Jim Cramer, “Power Lunch,” CNBC.com, the Breaking News Desk, Technical Operations and many other departments.

Where: CNBC Headquarters is based right across the George Washington Bridge at 900 Sylvan Ave., Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, 07632.

CNBC provides complimentary wi-fi enabled transportation to and from New York City, Brooklyn, Newark, Jersey City and Hoboken

CNBC also offers a free full service gym, dry cleaning service, gourmet cafeteria, shoe shine service and free on-site parking.

Hours: Fall and spring interns work a minimum of 16 hours a week and summer interns are asked to work full-time.

Knowledge of business news recommended but not required.

CNBC is closed on weekends and all major holidays.

In order to be considered for the CNBC Internship program, candidates must formally apply on online at nbcunicareers.com.

For further questions please email our CNBC Internship Program Manager, Ryan Ruggiero at: Ryan@nbc.com or our CNBC Campus Recruiter, Nicole Goolsby at: Nicole.Goolsby@nbcuni.com
